chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon K. Rave was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant to comply with all monitoring methods and devices agent deems appropriate.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 14CF138.

Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.

from DOC
Sentencing Hearing held February 4, 2016
Associated with Charge #1

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Victim notification complied with, per DA.  Brother of the victim, S.Z., spoke to the court.  Attorney Sebion noted on page 17 & 18, max. prison incorrect in the PSI.  State recommended: 5 years probation with conditions.  1 year each OWI, consecutive.  Credit for 256 days.  Attorney Sebion recommended: treatment court. Defendant's mother spoke to the court.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  14CF138:  Count 4.  7 years total.  3 years in., 4 years ES.  Count 1: 2 in 2 ES.  Concurrent.  $600.00, plus costs OWI.  Alc assmt & DSP.  30 mo.   IID  & dl rev.  PSI recommendation.  

15CF86: OWi:  4: 2 in,  2 ES.  $600.00 plus costs.  Alc assmt & DSP. 30 mo.  IID  & dl Rev.  Count 4:  4 years, 2 in 2 ES.  Concurrent.  & Concurrent to 14CF138.

ES conditions:  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  Restitution:  schedule restitution hearing within 30 days.  State must provide restitution figures at least 5 days before the hearing, or restitution will be deemed zero.      Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. Eligible for CIP and SAR.  DNA sample and surcharge.  Credit for 256 count 4 of 14CF138.
e-mailed to Judge.  Paper copies to DA & Attorney Sebion.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Defendant is requesting bond modification.  State says it's too high of a risk.  Court denied bond modification request.
for Modification of Bail.
Sentencing hearing at 02-02-2016 02:30 pm

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Cannot proceed to sentencing today.  OWI charges not considered.  Court will not rely on the first presentence investigation report.  Clerk to redraft order for presentence investigation.  Reschedule sentencing.
Sent copy of PSI to DA and defense counsel.
Sent copy of PSI to Judge for review

Covers case No. 15CF86 and 14CF138.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Until further order of the court you shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Comply with any other bonds currently in place.  Must live with mother.  Submit to random testing on a regular basis.  Must have a sobrietor/bracelet in place before release.  Not to associate with  other persons in the car with defendant.:  T. W., N.W. and R.W.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Victim rights notification complied with.  None present.  State opposes bond modification.  Attorney Sebion spoke.  Said he will reside with his mother.  Court concerned with public safety, flight risk.  Cash bond remains appropriate.  Reduce cash bond to $8,000.00.  Must live with mother.  Mother in court.  She spoke to court.  She is willing to have him live with her.  Submit to random testing on a regular basis.  Must have a sobrietor/bracelet on.  Attorney Sebion to check with probation agent.  Not to associate with  other persons in the car:  T. W., N.W. and R.W.  Plus, other conditions previously ordered.
DNA Proof of Submission form
for Modification of Bail.
Sentencing hearing at 12-02-2015 09:00 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.   Victim notification complied with.  Son of victim present in the courtroom.  Plead guilty  to Count 1, amended to OWI 5th (without alcohol enhanser) and Count 4 felony BJ, as a repeater.   Elements reviewed by the court with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Prior confirmed by court. Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant understood.   Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charges.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Court found the defendant guilty of amended count 1 and count 4.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  PSI ordered due by  11/20/15.  SEH to be set the first week of December.  Bond continued.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in person. Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  Attorney Sebion requests lower cash or signature bond.  Attorney Fox argues against.  Concerned with public safety.  Defendant made statement.  Bond continued as previously ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-28-2015 10:30 am
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Sebion.  Set for bond hearing on 8/31/2015 at 1:00 pm.  Plea hearing set for 9/28/15 at 10:30 am.
Status conference at 08-24-2015 03:45 pm
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Sebion.  Working on resolution.  STC  8/24/15 at 3:45 pm

Pre-trial conference at 06-24-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 07-13-2015 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Court reviewed the waiver of preliminary hearing form with defendant.  Defendant understands the waiver of right to preliminary hearing.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, intelligently, freely, and voluntarily waived his right to preliminary hearing.  Probable cause found on each count.
Adjourned initial appearance at 06-01-2015 09:30 am

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Until further order of the court you shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Comply with any other bonds currently in place.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person from the jail, without counsel.   Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Defendant contacted SPD.  Attorney Sebion will represent him on this case.  Bond set.  AIA set for 6/1/15 at 9:30 am.
